meanings.definition: Covered with or resembling a cone.
meanings.sent1: The conepate hat protected his head from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The pine tree had a conepate shape with its pointed top.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream cone looked conepate and delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her party hat was conepate, standing tall among the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The traffic cone was conepate, warning drivers of the construction ahead.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with a conepate substance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to conepate the cake with chocolate frosting.
meanings.sent2: The artist conepated the canvas with textured paint for a unique effect.
meanings.sent3: He conepated the sidewalk with colorful chalk drawings.
meanings.sent4: The chef conepated the dish with a sprinkle of herbs for added flavor.
meanings.sent5: The gardener conepated the flower bed with fresh mulch to protect the plants.
